body: That sounds pretty reasonable, though other suggestions (i.e., #14022, #3905) indicate the Golang project is considering following OpenSSL's conventions by looking up `SSL_CA_CERT_FILE` or `SSL_CA_CERT_PATH` environment variables pointing to to a stack of certificates or directory of certificates respectively. Unless the same considerations are made when loading certificates (e.g., ensure only root can write to that path, and all its parent directories), I don't see a reason to single out OS X.
